content: Matthijs Spaan TU Delft | EEMCS | Intelligent Systems | Sequential Decision Making | Matthijs Spaan Contact People Publications Research Teaching Projects (current) MMLL E-pi AI4B.io Projects (past) MEDIATOR LearnSDM FlexI DCSMART GCP BalanCity Smoover PURe-MaS MAIS-S DecPUCS URUS Resources Software Dec-POMDP POMDPs Activities Workshops Tutorials Events Matthijs Spaan I am a Professor of Reliable AI Algorithms, co-directing the Sequential Decision Making group in the department of Intelligent Systems, Delft University of Technology, Delft, The Netherlands. My recent research focus has been on developing reinforcement-learning algorithms for safe and robust decisions, such that we can make AI more reliable. Before, I was an Associate Professor in the Algorithmics group. Prior to joining TU Delft, I was a senior research scientist at the Institute for Systems and Robotics, Instituto Superior Técnico, Lisbon, Portugal. I have received a PhD degree in Computer Science (2006) and an MSc degree in Artificial Intelligence (2002), both from the University of Amsterdam, The Netherlands.
